alert.note: Alert for Alger; Baraga; Dickinson; Gogebic; Houghton; Iron; Keweenaw; Marquette; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 02 at 1:53PM EDT until May 10 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: .Recent widespread rain and snowfall have resulted in river and creek level rises across western and north-central Upper Michigan. Over the next few days, water levels in these places and low lying areas are expected to continue to rise. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Upper Michigan and western Upper Michigan, including the following areas, in central Upper Michigan, Alger, Baraga, Dickinson, Iron and Marquette. In western Upper Michigan, Gogebic, Keweenaw, Northern Houghton, Ontonagon and Southern Houghton. * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - With air temperatures trending around and above, there will be some melting and runoff from the melting snow. As a result, significant rises on area streams, rivers and creeks may occur over the next few days. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Alger; Baraga; Dickinson; Gogebic; Houghton; Iron; Keweenaw; Marquette; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton
